ARABIC: إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ ٱسْتَكْبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: except for Iblis who was arrogant and was one of the kafirun.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Except Iblis. He was filled with pride and turned an unbeliever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: except Iblis. He waxed proud and became one of the unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: except Iblis who puffed himself up with pride and became a disbeliever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Except Iblis; he was proud and was, from the beginning, a disbeliever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Except Iblis, he was proud and was one of the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But not Iblis: he was proud and he was one of the unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: save Iblis; he waxed proud, and was one of the unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Saving Iblis; he was scornful and became one of the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but not Satan, who was too proud. He became one of those who deny the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Not so lblis. He grew stiffnecked and became of the infidels.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: but not Iblis; he acted arrogantly and he was one of the faithless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Not so Iblis: he was haughty, and became one of those who reject Faith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Except Iblis (Satan) he was proud and was one of the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: except iblis (satan, the father of the jinn), he became too proud, for he was one of the unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Except for Satan. He was too proud, and one of the faithless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Except Iblees; he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:74]   except Iblīs, the father of the jinn, who was among the [audience of] angels; he was disdainful and he was one of the disbelievers, according to God’s knowledge, exalted be He.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Saving Iblis, he was scornful) he was too proud to prostrate before Adam (and became one of the disbelievers) because of disobeying Allah's command.
